Leroy Sané is stalling over a new Manchester City contract

Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola recently revealed that winger Leroy Sané has refused to sign a new deal at the club for the past 18 months, the Evening Standard reports.

Sané, who currently finds himself out of favour at Man City, has been the subject of recent transfer speculation over his future at the club.

In Friday’s press conference, Guardiola told the media: “(Leroy) we are one and a half years trying to sign his contract…We want him. If you want to extend his contract, it’s because you want him.”

There are no indications as of yet that Sané is agitating for a move with two years remaining on his current City deal.

Everton have made a provisional contract offer to Thomas Meunier

Our colleagues at Euro United report this evening that Premier League side Everton have offered provisional contract terms to Belgian international right-back and PSG man Thomas Meunier.

The player would like to stay in Paris, but is under contract until 2020 and it is widely expected that the Ligue 1 champions will seek to sell him.

No formal bid has been to PSG at this time by the Toffees, that is our understanding.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/everton-have-made-a-provisional-contract-offer-to-thomas-meunier/

Eintracht Frankfurt battle Tottenham Hotspur & Inter Milan for Max Kruse

Max Kruse was expected to leave the Bundesliga this summer after a fantastic campaign for Werder Bremen attracted interest from clubs around Europe.

However, Deich Stube claim that Eintracht Frankfurt, potentially in need of a Luka JoviÄ‡ replacement, could be set to battle the likes of Tottenham Hotspur and Inter Milan for the highly rated 31-year-old.

St Étienne boss Jean-Louis Gasset set to leave at the end of the season

RMC, L’Équipe and Canal + expect St Étienne manager Jean-Louis Gasset to quit his post at the end of the season.

The latter outlet claimed last night that the frontrunner to replace the former French national team assistant coach is Claude Puel.

Gasset said in last night’s press conference after beating OGC Nice: “We will have a sit down with the board at the beginning of the week after next… It is difficult to compete in Europe with a small squad, we will see if we can come to an agreement.”

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/st-etienne-boss-jean-louis-gasset-set-to-leave-at-the-end-of-the-season/

HERTHA BSC SIGN DEDRYCK BOYATA


The centre back joins Hertha from Celtic FC and signs a long-term contract.

Hertha BSC have made their first signing of the new season, as centre back Dedryck Boyata joins the club from Scottish side Celtic on a long-term deal. “We have been tracking Dedryck for a while and are fully convinced of his quality. We are sure that he will strengthen our defence,” said Michael Preetz on the transfer. “I am pleased that the deal has worked out,” said Boyata. “It is an ambitious club and we have similar goals. Roma’s managerial options

As Claudio Ranieri was brought in as a short-term option, Roma are looking for a new manager.

Marcelo Bielsa has become a potential option for the Roma bench, according to Gianluca Di Marzio. The Argentine tactician will meet with his current club Leeds this upcoming week and are likely to part ways.

Other options could be headed elsewhere. Gian Piero Gasperini looks likely to stay at Atalanta while Maurizio Sarri will either remain at Chelsea or join Milan or Juventus.

If Bielsa departs Leeds, he could well be on his way to the Italian capital.

https://www.getfootballnewsitaly.com/2019/romas-managerial-options/

Other options could be headed elsewhere. Gian Piero Gasperini looks likely to stay at Atalanta while Maurizio Sarri will either remain at Chelsea or join Milan or Juventus.

If Bielsa departs Leeds, he could well be on his way to the Italian capital.

Napoli-Ilicic, agreement in principle with the player: the latest

Napoli are focused on signing Josip Ilicic. The former Palermo striker has been decisive in Atalanta’s pursuit of a Champions League spot, he has scored twelve goals to go with seven assists and he’s now the top target to improve Carlo Ancelotti’s attack.

It appears that Napoli have already reached an agreement with the player on a three year deal with an annual salary of €2.2 million after taxes. Atalanta qualifying for the Champions League or not will be a big factor, and while the bergamaschi aren’t open to selling at the moment, Napoli hope to close the deal for around €12 million while also being able to offer Roberto Inglese.

Ilicid’s current contract expires in 2020 so the summer transfer window will be decisive. Atalanta could offer him an extension while also increasing his wages with Napoli monitoring the situation.

Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Kevin Trapp is available for transfer, according to Bild.

Real Betis makes offer for Celta Vigo's Lobotka, also in contact with Lopetegui: the latest

After the official separation with Quique Setién, Real Betis are working hard to find a new manager ahead of next season. One of the possibilities to take over is former Real Madrid manager, Julen Lopetegui, who the club have already been in contact with. However, it is not only management Real Betis are concerned with. Today, they have presented an offer to Celta Vigo - 20 million euros plus Ryad Boudebouz - for Slovakian midfielder Stanislav Lobotka - a target Roma were also focusing on.

WILSON VALUED AT £25M

Newcastle, Southampton and Brighton lead a host of clubs keen to sign Liverpool's young winger Harry Wilson.

Sky Sports News understands Liverpool will want up to £25m for the 22-year old who enjoyed an impressive year-long loan at Derby.

It's thought Crystal Palace could join a long list of Wilson's admirers if Wilfried Zaha leaves Selhurst Park this summer.

Wilson’s present club Derby are also keen on keeping him at Pride Park next campaign if they defeat Aston Villa at Wembley on Monday.

Interest in the versatile Welsh attacker has also spread across Europe with Augsburg, Hertha Berlin and Frankfurt in the Bundesliga - and several clubs in Spain monitoring negotiations.

Thursday’s Kicker are reporting that Bayern Munich are interested in signing 22-year-old Atlético Madrid midfielder Rodrigo.

The Spain international has a contract with La Liga club until 2023 but it’s suggested he has a €70 million release clause, which has also attracted the attention of Manchester City, Barcelona and Real Madrid.

Christian Benteke set to join Marouane Fellaini at Chinese club Shandong Luneng Taishan after £15m bid

Christian Benteke may leave Crystal Palace this summer after a £15 million offer from Shandong Luneng Taishan. The forward would join Marouane Fellaini, his Belgian compatriot, at the Chinese Super League club.

Benteke, 28, has a year left on his contract at Palace, where he is the club’s joint-top earner on £130,000 a week. He has been offered a deal worth £8 million a year (more than £150,000 a week) after tax by the Chinese club.

Former Juventus boss Lippi named China coach again

"Since Lippi coached the national team, the team has shown a positive spirit and a tenacious fighting belief," the statement continued.

"We believe that in the days to come, under the leadership of Lippi and his coaching team, the members of the Chinese national men's soccer team will make a full impact in their World Cup competition dreams."

Lille submit contract offer for Dodi Lukebakio

Ligue 1 side Lille have submitted a provisional contract offer the 21-year-old Watford attacker Dodi Lukebakio, formerly of Toulouse, according to L’Équipe.

The youngster has had a fantastic campaign with Fortuna Dusseldorf in the Bundesliga this season, scoring 14 goals and laying on 5 assists in an undoubtedly productive loan spell.

The newspaper claims that to convince the Hornets will take at least €12m, and they are expecting between €70m to €80m for Nicolas Pépé, so such a deal shouldn’t be a problem, but they will still have to convince the Belgian.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/lille-submit-contract-offer-for-dodi-lukebakio/

Said Berahino has been sacked by Stoke City, Sky Sports News understands.

Berahino was banned from driving and fined £75k earlier this month for drink driving. He was almost 3 times over the legal limit.

Stoke have told Berahino his contract is being terminated.

The player has three years left on that deal which runs until 2022.

Sources close to Berahino have told Sky Sports News they are considering a legal challenge against Stoke’s decision.

Mathieu Valbuena joining Olympiakos

Our colleagues at RMC report that former French international attacking midfielder Mathieu Valbuena is set to join Greek giants Olympiakos.

The 34-year-old arrived in Athens earlier this morning to undergo a medical ahead of signing a contract with a team looking to reclaim their national title after being pipped to it this time out by PAOK.

The former Marseille man is joining on a free transfer, with his deal with Fenerbahce expiring at the end of next month.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/mathieu-valbuena-joining-olympiakos/

André Villas-Boas reportedly agrees salary with Marseille

France Football report that Marseille have reached an agreement concerning salary with André Villas-Boas for him to become their new manager.

The contract agreed is set to run for two years on a pre-tax salary of €600k a month. This is a considerable concession from AVB on what he was earning at Zenit (€8.5m a year) or at Shanghai SIPG (€12m).

Now all that is left to do is to sort out how many members of staff AVB will bring in of his own… he has certainly convinced Sporting Director Andoni Zubizarreta.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2019/andre-villas-boas-reportedly-agrees-salary-with-marseille/

Two big Bundesliga clubs in discussions to sign Everton’s Henry Onyekuru

Everton winger Henry Onyekuru could be set to move to Germany this summer with representatives of the 21-year-old in discussions with two big clubs in the Bundesliga, according to sources contacted by Get German Football News.

Reports emerged last week of interest in the player from Bayern Munich, but Get German Football News understands that they may have competition for Onyekuru’s signature. A move to Bavaria would appear to be a logical one, with Bayern in need of wingers following the departures of Arjen Robben and Franck Ribery.

The Nigerian international scored 14 goals on loan at Galatasaray this season and was expected to return to Everton this summer, despite not yet making an appearance for the Premier League side.

Mathieu Valbuena joining Olympiakos

Our colleagues at RMC report that former French international attacking midfielder Mathieu Valbuena is set to join Greek giants Olympiakos.

The 34-year-old arrived in Athens earlier this morning to undergo a medical ahead of signing a contract with a team looking to reclaim their national title after being pipped to it this time out by PAOK.

The former Marseille man is joining on a free transfer, with his deal with Fenerbahce expiring at the end of next month.

Lazio, Gattuso an option for coaching job should Inzaghi leave

After he's left Milan, Rino Gattuso could already have another challenge to face: the now former Rossoneri's coach could have another bench in Serie A to sit on, with at least two interested clubs.

If Giampaolo should leave, the ex-Pisa coach could be an option for Sampdoria, who are also thinking about Pioli. Besides the Blucerchiati, the other option could be Lazio: should Simone Inzaghi leave, Gattuso would be among the first candidates on Tare's list to be the replacement.

Rafa Benitez has made 'contact' over Wesley Moraes as hopes of a new deal are boosted

Hopes of Rafa Benitez signing a new deal at Newcastle United have been boosted by claims the manager is making personal contact with transfer targets.

It is thought a £16million bid would be enough to bring Moraes to Tyneside from Belgian side Club Brugge, and while Italian side Lazio are also in contact, he is keen to play in the Premier League and is 'excited' by the prospect of playing in the black-and-white shirt.

Maurizio Sarri agrees terms with Juventus which would net him a £1.2m-a-year pay rise as Old Lady look to settle compensation with Chelsea after Europa League final

By ADRIAN KAJUMBA AND MATT BARLOW

Chelsea manager Maurizio Sarri is the man Juventus want to appoint as Massimiliano Allegri's successor.

Sarri has emerged as the Italian champions' first choice to fill their vacant position and confidence is growing at the Serie A giants that they can successfully agree a deal with Chelsea.

Sarri has two years left on his £5m-a-season Chelsea contract which he signed following his appointment last summer.

He would be in line for a pay rise should he seal a return to Italy having agreed in principle a three-year deal with Juventus worth around £6.2m-a-year.

https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-7075975/Chelsea-boss-Maurizio-Sarri-agrees-terms-Juventus-Serie-giants-look-appoint-him.html

Andy Carroll and Adrian to leave West Ham United


West Ham United can confirm that Andy Carroll and Adrian will leave the Club when their respective contracts expire on 30 June 2019.

The two long-serving players have combined to provide 13 seasons of service, playing 292 first-team matches between and providing some of the most memorable moments in recent Hammers history.

Also leaving the Club when their contracts expire at the end of June will be former France international midfielder Samir Nasri, who made six appearances in his half-season stay, and Spanish striker Toni Martinez, who featured three times in the FA Cup in January 2018.

Uli Hoeneß admits difficulty in signing Leroy Sané & Rodrigo

Bayern Munich President Uli Hoeneß has spoken on the difficulty of signing reported targets Leroy Sané and Atletico Madrid’s Rodri this summer.

Rumours have been rife over Sané returning to Germany, with the Manchester City winger currently out of favour under Pep Guardiola. Hoeneß however, has admitted that the financial strain of such a deal could be too much to overcome.

Speaking on the Sané situation, Hoeneß told SportBild: “I do not have exact numbers yet, but I think that the financial framework is very difficult. The whole package is difficult.”

He also appeared to dismiss recent links to Spanish holding midfielder Rodri, telling SportBild that he “does not know” the player.

Hysaj announces Napoli departure

The 25-year-old right-back has announced to Albanian media that he will leave Napoli for a “new adventure.”

Elseid Hysaj joined Napoli in the summer of 2015 from Empoli alongside Maurizio Sarri.

After over 130 appearances with the Partenopei, Hysaj will depart this summer.

Napoli are on the verge of securing the services of right-back Giovanni Di Lorenzo from Empoli as a replacement.

Tottenham end interest in Barcelona's Andre Gomes after Everton loan spell

Tottenham have ended their interest in Barcelona midfielder Andre Gomes, Sky Sports News understands.

The Portugal international impressed last season on loan at Everton, where he made 29 appearances.

Barcelona are keen to offload Gomes, but are demanding a fee between £25m and £35m for the 25-year-old.

Sky Sports News understands the Hammers remain interested and will do their utmost in their attempts to bring him to the London Stadium.

https://www.skysports.com/transfer/news/12691/11732071/tottenham-end-interest-in-barcelonas-andre-gomes-after-everton-loan-spell

West Ham United to sign experienced goalkeeper Roberto


West Ham United are pleased to confirm the signing of Spanish goalkeeper Roberto on a free transfer.

The experienced 33-year-old will join the Hammers on 1 July, after his contract with La Liga club Espanyol expires, on a two-year deal with the Club having the option for a further 12 months.

Roberto, who has played more than 300 senior matches in Spain, Portugal and Greece, winning six trophies and appearing in the UEFA Champions League, is looking forward to a new challenge with the Hammers.

Barcelona target Vignato brothers

Spanish champions Barcelona have targeted the Vignato brothers at Chievo Verona, according to Gianluca Di Marzio.

18-year-old Emanuel has already made 10 appearances for Chievo in Serie A, scoring one goal and one assist.

His younger bother Samuel is just 15-years-old and plays on the Primavera squad.

Chievo are asking €8 million for both brothers but Barça believe that price is too high.

The clubs will hold further talks in the future to try and agree upon a deal.

Manchester City narrow down holding midfielder shortlist

Manchester City have settled upon a shortlist of three players as they look to solve their ongoing search for a holding midfielder, Sky Sports News understands.

Atletico Madrid's Rodri is seen to be the ideal long-term replacement for Fernandinho - and has a release clause of around £60m.

Lyon's Tanguy Ndombele has been closely watched ever since impressing Pep Guardiola during two matches in this season's Champions League group stage.

And Sky Sports News has now learned that Real Madrid's 24 year-old midfielder Marcos Llorente is the third player on City's shortlist.

https://www.skysports.com/transfer/news/12691/11732535/manchester-city-narrow-down-holding-midfielder-shortlist

Dear Gunners

We were close to add an important chapter to this amazing club's history. But to be close ... is unfortunately not good enough. This is hard to accept. I'm very disappointed.
It was our objective to bring Arsenal back on the highest international level and to win trophies. Both belong to this great club. I wish my teammates, my coach and his staff, all hard-working employees and all Gunner fans simply the best! I'm confident our team can complete our mission next season! I loved to be a part of this club. It was a great challenge and experience without a happy end, unfortunately. Thank you very much for your overwhelming support! It was much appreciated!

See you
Stephan

Lucas Perez returns to Spain with Alaves



Lucas Perez has joined Spanish Primera Division club Alaves on a permanent deal for an undisclosed fee.

The Spaniard returns to his homeland after a single season with West Ham United, during which he scored six goals in 19 appearances.

Lucas became the first Hammers substitute in 19 years to score twice after being introduced from the bench into a Premier League match when he netted a brace in the 3-1 win over Cardiff City in December 2018.

West Ham United would like to thank Lucas for his efforts and wish him the best for his future career.

https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2019/june/03-june/lucas-perez-returns-spain-alaves

COLE RELEASED BY DERBY

Ashley Cole is among the Derby County players being released this summer after they failed to win promotion to the Premier League.

The ex-Chelsea star – who is 38 – joined the Rams n a short-term deal until the end of the season in January and he started in their play-off final defeat to Aston Villa.

Derby are also releasing David Nugent, Efe Ambrose, Alex Pearce and Marcus Olsson when their contracts expire on June 30.

Craig Bryson is also out of contract but the club are talking to him about an extension.
